intro: Halanthium purpureum, commonly known as the purple water flea, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Zosteraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching structure and the presence of specialized air-filled bladders that help it float. Halanthium purpureum plays a minor role in aquatic ecosystems, primarily as a food source for small invertebrates and fish.
